src/Base/Base.js.description:
A general purpose component that converts our props into styles
defined by the user. Heavily inspired by (and somewhat directly copied)
from rebass.

underlayColor.description: Underlay color. Use 'darken' to automatically darken the backgroundColor. *

height.description: set the height of the element *

width.description: set the width of the element *

panza.description: theme provided by a higher order component *

src/Base/TextBase.js.description:
A general purpose text component which
converts props into styles defined in the configuration.
Unlike Base, TextBase supports special Text props.

panza.description: a theme provided by a higher order component *

inverted.description: use the inverted color (by default, white) *

height.description: set the height of the element *

width.description: set the width of the element *

src/Buttons/Button.js.description:
A basic button that inherits from Base, and provides colourization
based upon background color configuration.

disabled.description: disables the button, and reduces its opacity *

textColor.description: style text colour when using label prop *

segmented.description: A helper to create segemented controls that align together *

src/Card/Card.js.description:
A very basic Card wrapper
@composes Base

src/Icons/BaseIcon.android.js.description:
Our base icon component that all other icons
compose. It uses ionicons, as provided by
react-native-vector-icons

src/Icons/BaseIcon.js.description:
Our base icon component that all other icons
compose. It uses ionicons, as provided by
react-native-vector-icons

src/Image/Image.js.description: Fade-in an image when it loads.

circular.description: set the border radius to be fully round (given an equal height/width) *

rounded.description: the border radius of the image *

src/Nav/NavBar.js.description:
Static navigation bar that mimics that found
within ReactNative. To be used when you want a static
representation of the NavBar, without transitions.

src/Nav/NavIconContainer.js.description:
A wrapper for <Icon /> that positions it correctly
in a navigation bar.

src/Nav/NavTitle.js.description:
Renders text stylized for the Navigation Bar title.

On iOS it composes PrimaryText.

On Android, it composes LargeText.

@composes Text

src/Nav/NavTouchableIcon.js.description:
Wrap Icon components within NavTouchableIcon for display
of an Icon in the Navigation bar. You may need to fiddle
around with the sizing of the Icon on android and ios devices
to ensure that they look right.

src/Pages/Error.js.description:
Display an error, with messages and actions depending
upon the user state. Particularly useful with Relay.Renderer
when an error state and retry function are provided.

defaultValue.value: 'Hmm, loading appears to be taking a while.'
'It\'s possible that our server are under heavy load, or that your internet connection is slow. Please try again.'
'Please ensure that you are connected to the internet.'

src/Pages/Loading.js.description:
Displays a loading indicator, and on iOS an optional
loading message.

src/Row/Divider.js.description:
A simple component used to separate rows, with an
optional inset margin on the left or right.

panza.description: theme provided by higher order component *

src/Row/TouchableRow.js.description:
The basic RowCell for use within ListView. It displays
an image, primary text, secondary text, a value,
and an arrow right icon if the respective props are
specified.

@composes TouchableRowCell, Image, Text

src/Row/TouchableRowCell.js.description:
A touchable row cell container, typically used
rendering rows in a <ListView>.

src/RowInput/InputAddRow.js.description:
Arrow row button. Typically the condensed form
will be used in conjunction with <RemovableInput />

src/RowInput/InputDatePicker.js.description:
InputDatePicker a cross-platform InputRow inputting
dates.

On iOS devices, the row examples to reveal
DatePickerIOS when selected. The humanized date should
be supplied as the value prop, and it should be
updated when the value of the date-picker changes.

On Anroid, the date-picker prompts the user to select
a date in a modal menu.

@composes InputTouchable, DatePickerIOS, DatePickerAndroid

onToggleExpansion.description: function called to toggle the visibility of the date-picker. (iOS only) *

value.description: the currently selected date to be displayed in collapsed row. *

src/RowInput/InputExpandable.js.description:
A touchable input field that expands (iOS) or
pops up (Android) to reveal a picker widget.

src/RowInput/InputGroup.js.description:
Wrapping components with InputGroup gives you the
option of giving Inputs dividing borders, dividing
borders with an inset, a top border (with a unique inset value),
a bottom border (with a unique inset value), shared background
colours, margins, and a label. You could supply your own
child components, too.

inset.description: left margin inset for the divider border *

showBottomBorder.description: whether to show the bottom border *

showBorder.description: whether to show the dividing border *

topInset.description: left margin inset of the top border *

bottomInset.description: left margin inset of the bottom border *

label.description: an optional label for the input group *

src/RowInput/InputHelpText.js.description:
InputHelpText is typically used after an InputGroup to
offer additional information about the above inputs. This is
just a simple wrapper around SecondaryText with some padding
provided, and the text color set to light.

@composes Text

src/RowInput/InputPicker.js.description:
InputPicker provides a unified API for Android and iOS
picker rows.

On iOS, when the user selects the picker row,
we want the row to expand to reveal the picker, which is the
child passed to this component. The value prop appears
on the top right of the picker row. It should be the humanized
version of the selected value in the picker.

On Android, we display the picker as the row itself. When
selected, the picker prompt will occur. A label is
rendered above the picker. The value prop is ignored,
since the Android picker already prints the value for us.

@composes InputTouchable, InputExpandable

onToggleExpansion.description: a function called when toggling the visibility of the picker. (iOS only) *

value.description: the picker value displayed in the row. (iOS only) *

expanded.description: controls whether the picker is visible. (iOS only) *

panza.description: theme provided by higher order component *

src/RowInput/InputRow.js.description:
A collection of RowActions to be displayed behind
a revealing row.

A row action that hide underneath the row, such
as 'Delete', or 'Edit', etc.

src/RowInput/InputRowRevealOptions.js.description:
Revealable row options container. Typically used
to delete a row.

src/RowInput/InputToggle.js.description:
An basic input row with a label and Switch, allowing
the user to toggle a boolean value.

src/RowInput/InputTouchable.js.description:
An InputTouchable is typically used when you want the user
to select a value within another view -- whether it's a ListView,
PopupMenu, etc. This module composes TouchableRow, providing
default heights and styling to fit in with other Input rows.

@composes TouchableRow

src/RowInput/RevealingRow.js.description:
ReavealingRow enables a row to have revealed options
that appear, for instance, when editing it.
